[date of source: March 19, 2007
Finding aid encoded by Valerie Higgins, Library/Archives, Indiana University, February 24, 2009

did.head: Summary Information
did.abstract: The Clarke, T.E.B. mss., 1934-1988, consists of the papers of British author and screenwriter Thomas Ernest Bennett Clarke, 1907-1989.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Thomas Ernest Bennett Clarke, 1907-1989, wrote numerous story outlines and original screenplays for Ealing Studios, including the screenplay for The Lavender Hill Mob for which he won the Academy Award and Venice Award for 1952. In addition, he wrote screen adaptations for such works as A Tale of Two Cities and D.H. Lawrence's Sons and Lovers which earned him an Oscar nomination. He also wrote television scripts and a play This Undesirable Residence. His writings consist mostly of fiction, but include an autobiography, What's Yours?: The Student's Guide to Publand, newspaper and magazine articles.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged in the following series: I. Biographical; II. Correspondence; III. Contracts; IV. Scripts; V. Writings; VI. Photographs; VII. Miscellaneous; VIII. Printed.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Clarke, T.E.B. mss., 1934-1988, consists of the papers of British author and screenwriter Thomas Ernest Bennett Clarke, 1907-1989. The papers include biographical material, correspondence, contracts, scripts, writings, photographs, and printed materials.

controlaccess.head: Indexing Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in IUCAT, the IU Libraries' online catalog. Materials about related topics, persons or places can be found by searching the catalog using these terms.

userestrict.head: Usage Restrictions
userestrict.p: Photocopying permitted only with permission of the Curator of Manuscripts, Lilly Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item], Clarke, T.E.B. mss., Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana.

did.unittitle: Punch contributions: correspondence with Punch magazine and the writings submitted by Clarke

scopecontent.p: One folder per title, unless otherwise indicated.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged in alphabetical order by title.

did.unittitle: The Ant and the Grasshopper. script
Bell, Book and Candle. notes only
The Herring Farm (or: High and Dry ) with Richard Hughes. script
The Horse Without a Head. script
Judy Belle and the Poorest Millionaire. outline, script
The Ladykillers. script (worked on by Clarke, but no credit given)
The Lavender Hill Mob. treatment, program, script
Law and Disorder (or: Passing strange ). outline, script
The Magnificent Travels, Adventures, Campaigns, Loves and Lives of Baron Munchausen. three scripts
The Man Who Seduced the Bank. two scripts
Premiere. program only (Royal film performance to aid the Cinematograph Trade Benevolent Fund, 1952)
Ratcliff Highway. treatment, four scripts, misc. pages of scripts and notes
The Road to Killiecrankie (adapted from: I Saw Him Die). outline
Roman Holiday, by William Wyler. script (worked on by Clarke, but no credit given)
Rosika and the Ark of Peace. outline
The Storm of London. treatment, outline, notes, script
Superthief. three scripts, miscellaneous revised pages and notes
A Tale of Two Cities. outline, script
Do You Believe in Ghosts. two scripts
The First of the Many. outline
The Siege of Adelaide Square. outline
Up She Goes (Episode: The difficult passenger). script

scopecontent.p: One title per folder, unless otherwise indicated.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Writings by Clarke, followed by Writings by Others. Both sections arranged alphabetically by title.

did.unittitle: Account of Lord George Sackville. typescript
A Black Yankee at the Court of Queen Liz. typescripts, outlines, notes, clippings
Borrowed Plumes. two typescripts, miscellaneous pages
A Dozen and One Nights. two typescripts
The Dumb Husband's Cookbook. typescript, notes
A Friend in Need. typescript, notes
Grim Fairy Tales: 1 - The Ex-King and the Fish. typescript
The Heligolanders. typescript, miscellaneous pages, notes, clippings
Intimate Relations. typescript, illustrations, miscellaneous materials
The Last of the Giants. summary, notes, miscellaneous pages, clippings
Little Man, You've Had It. typescript
Marriages Are Made in Bond Street. typescript
No Flowers for Ronnie. two typescripts
Reminiscences of Mr. Timothy Quirke, Con Man - 1 & 2. typescript
The Revolt. outline, notes, two typescripts
Sally Martin Up. notes, typescript, photocopy of typescript, clippings
There'll Always Be a Frinton. typescript, clipping
This Is Where I Came In. proofs of photos only
Two and Two Make Five. synopsis
The World Was Mine. book jacket only
Bestseller, by A.M. Drew, foreword by T.E.B. Clarke. typescript, notes
Passport to Parkchester, screenplay by Paul Doherty. script

did.physdesc: (22 photographs, including photo of drawing and several duplicates)

did.unittitle: Sheet music. Policemen's Song, from The Blue Lamp and typescript of lyrics; White Suit Samba from The Man in the White Suit
Miscellaneous. calling cards, notes, invitations, programs, etc.
Tear sheets of Clarke's column in The Evening News, 1941-1944
Clippings about Clarke's books, arranged alphabetically by title
Clippings about Clarke's films, arranged alphabetically by title
Clippings about Clarke's theatre and television projects
Magazines and tear sheets from magazines containing articles, stories, etc. by Clarke
Empire News, May 6, 20, 27, June 3, 10, 17, 24, July 8, 15, 22; features the serial Murder at the Festival by Clarke
